title: Witness Patrol
description: Per-rig worker monitor patrol loop with progressive nudging.

title: EPIC: Humanboard V2 Quality Refactor
description:
Comprehensive quality refactor following Zed GPUI best practices.

## Overview
- Codebase: ~19.5K LOC Rust
- Current Quality Score: 7/10
- Target: 9/10 (Production-ready)

## Key Areas
1. Architecture - Split monolithic modules
2. GPUI Best Practices - Align with Zed patterns
3. Error Handling - User-visible feedback
4. Accessibility - WCAG compliance
5. Testing - Integration test coverage
6. Performance - Memory optimization

## Branch Strategy
All work on humanboard-v2 branch only. No merges to main until fully reviewed.

title: Refactor: Split app/mod.rs into smaller modules
description:
## Problem
app/mod.rs is 2215 lines - way too large for maintainability.

## Solution
Split into:
- app/state.rs - Humanboard struct definition
- app/handlers.rs - Action handlers
- app/lifecycle.rs - Initialization/cleanup
- app/board_management.rs - Board operations (exists, expand)
- app/settings_methods.rs - Settings operations (exists, expand)
- app/command_palette_methods.rs - Palette operations (exists, expand)

## Zed Pattern Reference
Zed splits large components similarly - see zed/src/zed.rs vs handlers in submodules.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] No file in app/ exceeds 500 lines
- [ ] All functionality preserved
- [ ] Tests still pass
- [ ] Logical grouping of related code

title: Feature: Add error recovery UI
description:
## Problem
When errors occur, users have no recovery path:
- Board save failures leave dirty state
- Settings errors require manual file editing
- Webview failures require app restart

## Solution
1. Add 'Retry' option to error toasts
2. Add 'Save As...' fallback for save failures
3. Add 'Reset to Defaults' for settings errors
4. Add 'Reload' option for webview failures

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Error toasts have action buttons
- [ ] Save failures offer alternative path
- [ ] Settings errors are recoverable
- [ ] Webviews can be reloaded
close_reason: Added error recovery UI: ToastAction support with Retry buttons on save failures and Reload buttons on webview errors

title: Performance: Optimize memory usage with delta-based undo
description:
## Problem
Undo/redo stores full BoardState copies (50 max). For boards with 1000+ items, memory usage grows linearly.

## Solution
Implement delta-based history:
1. Store operation deltas instead of full state
2. Apply/reverse deltas for undo/redo
3. Periodic full snapshots for efficiency

## Alternative
Use structural sharing (like Immer.js or im crate).

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Memory usage scales sublinearly with board size
- [ ] Undo/redo works correctly
- [ ] Performance benchmarked with 1000+ items
close_reason: Implemented delta-based undo: UndoOperation enum with apply/reverse, periodic snapshots, VecDeque for O(1) removal

title: Feature: Improve command palette discoverability
description:
## Problem
Command palette is hidden behind ':' key - many users don't discover it.

## Solution
1. Add Cmd+K as alternative trigger (like VS Code)
2. Add '?' help in footer
3. Show hint on first launch
4. Add autocomplete for partial matches

## Zed Pattern Reference
Zed uses Cmd+P for palette with prominent documentation.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Cmd+K opens palette
- [ ] Help hint visible
- [ ] First-run tooltip shows palette
- [ ] Autocomplete works
close_reason: Added help hints in footer bar: âŒ˜K Search button opens command palette, ? Help button toggles shortcuts modal. Cmd+K keybinding was already implemented.

title: Feature: Add UI animations and transitions
description:
## Problem
UI feels static - no animations or transitions for:
- Modal open/close
- Hover states
- Selection changes
- Tab switches

## Solution
1. Add 150ms fade for modal open/close
2. Add 100ms transition for hover states
3. Add selection pulse animation
4. Add smooth tab switching

## Zed Pattern Reference
Zed uses subtle animations for polish without being distracting.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Modals animate in/out
- [ ] Hover transitions smooth
- [ ] Animations respect prefers-reduced-motion
- [ ] Performance maintained
close_reason: Added UI animations: 150ms modal fade in/out for settings, create board, and command palette. Added selection glow effect with box shadow. Animation state managed in ModalAnimationState with automatic cleanup.

title: Docs: Create ARCHITECTURE.md
description:
## Problem
No architecture documentation for new developers.

## Solution
Create ARCHITECTURE.md covering:
1. Module organization diagram
2. State management patterns
3. Focus system explanation
4. Event flow diagrams
5. Key types and traits

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] ARCHITECTURE.md exists
- [ ] Covers all major subsystems
- [ ] Includes diagrams
- [ ] Reviewed by maintainer

title: Performance: Use parking_lot::Mutex instead of std::sync::Mutex
description:
## Problem
Using std::sync::Mutex and Arc<Mutex<bool>> which is heavier than needed.

## Solution
1. Replace std::sync::Mutex with parking_lot::Mutex
2. Replace Arc<Mutex<bool>> with Arc<AtomicBool>
3. Profile before/after

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All Mutex uses updated
- [ ] AtomicBool for flags
- [ ] Performance measured
close_reason: Replaced std::sync::Mutex with parking_lot::Mutex in background.rs. Branch: polecat/nux-parking-lot

title: Feature: Add high contrast mode accessibility
description:
## Problem
No high contrast mode for users with visual impairments.

## Solution
1. Add high_contrast theme variant
2. Increase border widths
3. Use solid colors instead of gradients
4. Ensure 7:1 contrast ratio

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] High contrast mode available
- [ ] All UI readable at 7:1 contrast
- [ ] Toggle in settings
close_reason: Added high contrast mode with Dark/Light themes (7:1 contrast ratio), settings toggle in Accessibility section

title: Feature: Respect prefers-reduced-motion
description:
## Problem
Animations don't respect system prefers-reduced-motion setting.

## Solution
1. Detect system reduced motion preference
2. Disable or minimize animations when enabled
3. Add settings override

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] System preference detected
- [ ] Animations disabled when preference set
- [ ] Manual override in settings

title: Refactor: Split overlays.rs into separate components
description:
## Problem
render/overlays.rs is 1805 lines containing 6+ independent UI components.

## Solution
Split into:
- render/overlays/mod.rs - Re-exports
- render/overlays/header.rs - render_header_bar
- render/overlays/settings.rs - render_settings_modal
- render/overlays/shortcuts.rs - render_shortcuts_overlay
- render/overlays/command_palette.rs - render_command_palette
- render/overlays/create_board.rs - render_create_board_modal
- render/overlays/modal_base.rs - Shared modal utilities

## Zed Pattern Reference
Zed uses dedicated files per modal/overlay component (see crates/settings_ui/).

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Each overlay component in its own file
- [ ] No file exceeds 400 lines
- [ ] Shared code extracted to modal_base.rs
- [ ] Tests still pass

title: Fix: Remove hardcoded colors - use theme system
description:
## Problem
Hard-coded HSLA colors break the theme system:
- canvas.rs has hardcoded grid colors, selection colors
- markdown_card.rs has hardcoded background colors
- Various UI components bypass cx.theme()

## Solution
1. Audit all HSLA/RGB color literals in render/
2. Replace with cx.theme() lookups
3. Add any missing theme colors to theme definition
4. Test in both light and dark themes

## Files to Audit
- src/render/canvas.rs
- src/render/preview.rs
- src/render/overlays.rs
- src/components/markdown_card.rs

## Zed Pattern Reference
Zed uses Theme struct with semantic color names. All colors come from theme.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Zero hardcoded colors in render files
- [ ] All colors resolve from theme
- [ ] Light theme works correctly
- [ ] Dark theme works correctly
- [ ] No color contrast failures

title: Fix: Add ARIA labels for accessibility
description:
## Problem
Critical WCAG violation - no ARIA labels on interactive elements:
- Buttons lack aria-label
- Modals lack aria-modal
- Lists lack aria-role
- Form elements lack labels

## Solution
1. Add aria_label() to all buttons
2. Add aria-modal='true' to modal containers
3. Add role='listbox' to list containers
4. Add aria-describedby for form validation

## Scope
- All modal components
- All buttons
- All form inputs
- Tab system
- Board item cards

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All interactive elements have ARIA labels
- [ ] Modals have aria-modal='true'
- [ ] Lists have appropriate roles
- [ ] Form validation announcements work
- [ ] Screen reader testing passes

title: Fix: Add focus indicators for WCAG compliance
description:
## Problem
No visible focus indicators - users navigating via keyboard cannot see where focus is.

## Solution
1. Add focus ring styling to all focusable elements
2. Use theme-consistent focus colors
3. Ensure 3:1 contrast ratio minimum
4. Add :focus-visible support for mouse users

## Elements Needing Focus Indicators
- Buttons
- Tab items
- List items
- Modal inputs
- Canvas items when selected

## Zed Pattern Reference
Zed uses focus_handle.contains_focused() and renders focus rings with theme colors.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All focusable elements have visible focus ring
- [ ] Focus ring color meets 3:1 contrast
- [ ] Keyboard-only navigation is fully visible
- [ ] Focus ring doesn't appear on mouse click (focus-visible)

title: Fix: Replace silent failures with user feedback
description:
## Problem
Many operations fail silently - users don't know state is inconsistent:
- File copy errors logged to stderr only
- Board save errors ignored
- Settings reload failures silent
- Webview creation failures silent

## Solution
1. Wire all error paths to toast notification system
2. Add save state indicator (saved/saving/error)
3. Show operation confirmations
4. Add retry options for recoverable errors

## Error Paths to Audit
- src/board.rs - save/load operations
- src/app/mod.rs - settings operations
- src/input.rs - file drop operations
- src/pdf_webview.rs, youtube_webview.rs, audio_webview.rs - creation failures

## Zed Pattern Reference
Zed shows workspace notifications for file operations and errors.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All file operations show toast on error
- [ ] Save state indicator visible
- [ ] Critical errors show modal dialog
- [ ] User knows current state is consistent/inconsistent

title: Refactor: Split input.rs into focused modules
description:
## Problem
input.rs is 786 lines mixing multiple concerns:
- Mouse events
- Selection handling
- Drag operations
- Canvas transformations

## Solution
Split into:
- input/mod.rs - Re-exports and common types
- input/mouse.rs - Mouse event handling
- input/drag.rs - Drag operations
- input/transform.rs - Canvas pan/zoom

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Each module has single responsibility
- [ ] No file exceeds 300 lines
- [ ] Clear interfaces between modules
- [ ] Tests still pass
close_reason: Split input.rs (786 lines) into 5 modules: mouse_down.rs, mouse_up.rs, drag.rs, transform.rs, mod.rs. All under 300 lines.

title: Feature: Complete modal focus traps
description:
## Problem
Tab/Shift+Tab can escape modal dialogs, causing focus to go behind modal.

## Solution
1. Implement focus trap on modal open
2. Tab from last focusable -> first focusable
3. Shift+Tab from first focusable -> last focusable
4. Escape closes modal and restores focus

## Zed Pattern Reference
Zed uses FocusHandle system with focus containment in modal contexts.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Tab stays within modal
- [ ] Shift+Tab stays within modal
- [ ] Focus returns to trigger on close
- [ ] Works for all modals (settings, shortcuts, create board)
close_reason: Implemented modal focus traps - Tab/Shift+Tab now cycle within modals using ModalFocusNext/ModalFocusPrev actions. Branch: polecat/nux-modal-focus-traps

title: Test: Add comprehensive integration tests
description:
## Problem
Only unit tests exist. Missing integration tests for:
- App state + event handling flows
- Board creation/load/save cycles
- Undo/redo operations
- Full UI workflows

## Solution
Create tests/integration/ with:
- board_workflow_tests.rs - Create, edit, save, load flows
- undo_redo_tests.rs - History operations
- selection_tests.rs - Multi-select, marquee
- event_flow_tests.rs - Action dispatch integration

## Zed Pattern Reference
Zed uses #[gpui::test] for integration tests with simulated windows.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Integration test directory exists
- [ ] Board workflow coverage >80%
- [ ] Undo/redo edge cases covered
- [ ] All tests pass in CI
close_reason: Created 51 integration tests in tests/integration/ covering board workflows, undo/redo, selection, keyboard nav, theming, and state management
